titleStmt.title: News article "Architect to Submit Girls' Cottage Plan." Jacksonville, FL. No date given.
titleStmt.author: Unknown

respStmt.name: Tru Leverette Hall and Janaya Ferrer

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author writes a news article regarding Duval County Parental Home - a cottage type building to accommodate thirty girls and the administrative offices.

objectDesc.p: A single clipping of a typewritten news article.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

div.head:
Architect to Submit
Girls' Cottage Plan

div.p:
Plans for a cottage type building to
accommodate thirty girls and the ad-
ministration offices of the Duval Coun-
ty Parental home will be presented by
Jefferson D. Powell, architect, at the
regular meeting of the Parentalparental home
board of managers, to be held at the
courthouse at 9 oâ€™clock this morning.

The building will be the first unit of
the two-unit plant contemplated in the
act of legislature authorizing the ex-
penditures of $50,000 for the home for
delinquent and dependent children who
become wards of the juvenile court in
the county.

Until the second unit is constructed
next year, the boys will be quartered in
an available building near the 30-acre
tract near Hogan on which the home
is to be built, it was said.
